intro: Tarenna longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved tarenna, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Its small, white flowers are followed by yellowish-orange berries that mature in late summer. Tarenna longifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within primary forests.
